name: Smoked Eggs
author: Jackie B
summary: This smoked egg recipe is incredibly easy. I learned it from a neighbor and it is a fun way to use up the extra space in your smoker grill. The eggs turn a lovely brown color and have a consistency similar to boiled eggs. The insides have a tinted brown color, too. Reduce cook time if you prefer a softer boiled egg.
ingredients: 6  fresh raw eggs in the shell
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat a smoker grill to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C)
Add wood chips according to manufacturer's directions
Place whole eggs directly on the grate of the preheated smoker
Cook, without turning, for 2 hours, maintaining an even temperature
Transfer eggs to a plate and allow to cool completely before peeling
